channel.title: Help With Run.bat
channel.description:
Hello, i managed to get my compiler working.
But now im having trouble with running my server.
I have set my environmental variables and still, it's not running.
Should i have PATH in user variables or system variables?
I have CLASSPATH in system variables and PATH in user variables.
If you could help you will make my day because i really want to start a server again. :)

item.title: Help With Run.bat
item.dc:creator: @peepzi peepzi
item.description:
@peepzi wrote:

No

I really wish i could get this to work

I can compile but i can’t run it.

-sigh-

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Run.bat
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

Try

@echo off title server java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Run.bat
item.dc:creator: @peepzi peepzi
item.description:
@peepzi wrote:

I did that, it still doesn’t work.

@echo off
title Augeas Pkz
“C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_14/bin/java.exe” -Xmx512m server
pause

Bold= Exactly where java.exe is.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Run.bat
item.dc:creator: @Veng4lyfe Veng4lyfe
item.description:
@Veng4lyfe wrote:

[code][code]well if you got JDK 14 like me

go to edit then where it says


jdk1.6.0_##

You put yours in like this

[/code]

jdk1.6.0_10 and turn that into
jdk1.6.0_14 ect…
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Run.bat
item.dc:creator: @peepzi peepzi
item.description:
@peepzi wrote:

The variables are but i don’t know what i should put in my run.bat to define my java version.

Java is located here: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe

My CLASSPATH has that as it’s variable, same goes for PATH.

My runserver:

@echo off title Augeas Pkz "C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_14/bin/java.exe" -Xmx512m server pause

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Run.bat
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

You have to have JDk installed and correctley route your batch file to the classpaths.

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Run.bat
item.dc:creator: @peepzi peepzi
item.description:
@peepzi wrote:

This happens with silab client:

[code]C:\Users\Torkko\Desktop>java -Xmx512m -jar SilabClient.jar 0 0 highmem members
0
‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

C:\Users\Torkko\Desktop>pause
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

My Server:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:252) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:320) Could not find the main class: server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
